name: Ball of Light Magazine - No. 3
description:
Our quarterly Ball of Light publication covers news about the Ball of Light project mixed with exposes on some of the amazing locations discovered.

The magazine is a vehicle for Denis Smith to share his many journeys searching out fun and exciting places to find the Ball of Light, along with some insights into the technical aspects of light painting in general.

This is a high quality glossy publication, 44 full colour pages packed with amazing examples of the Ball of Light photographic project.

Each magazine comes packaged in a clear cello bag to arrive in your hands in pristine condition. Size 210mm x 270mm

ISSUE 3 - AUGUST 2012
+ Yourambulla
+ Brachina Gorge
+ Waukaringa
+ Interview with Light Painter "Darius Twin"
+ Technical Tips - Lenses
+ Feature full and ad free!

name: Ball of Light Magazine - Back Issue No. 2
description: Our quarterly Ball of Light publication covers news about the Ball of Light project mixed with exposes on some of the amazing locations discovered. The magazine is a vehicle for Denis Smith to share his many journeys searching out fun and exciting places to find the Ball of Light, along with some insights into the technical aspects of light painting in general. This is a high quality glossy publication, 38 full colour pages packed with amazing examples of the Ball of Light photographic project. Each magazine comes packaged in a clear cello bag to arrive in your hands in pristine condition. Size 210mm x 270mm BACK ISSUE NO. 2 - SUMMER 2012 + Reflections + The Twelve Apostles + Ball of Light in Europe + Interview with Light Painter "Tackyshack" + Light Painting Techniques + Feature full and ad free!

name: Ball of Light Magazine - Back Issue No. 1
description: Our quarterly Ball of Light publication covers news about the Ball of Light project mixed with exposes on some of the amazing locations discovered. The magazine is a vehicle for Denis Smith to share his many journeys searching out fun and exciting places to find the Ball of Light, along with some insights into the technical aspects of light painting in general. This is a high quality glossy publication, 38 full colour pages packed with amazing examples of the Ball of Light photographic project. Each magazine comes packaged in a clear cello bag to arrive in your hands in pristine condition. Size 210mm x 270mm BACK ISSUE NO. 1 - SPRING 2011 + Lake Mungo + Kangaroo Island + The Wrecker Yard + Ball of Light Movie + Feature full and ad free!

name: Dismantlers Delight
description:
While on location at this wrecking yard, I had ages to look at the cars and so started to figure out why each car one was there. Many were due to simple mechanical failures as the bodies were untouched. But many of them were obviously in bad accidents!

I came to the realisation that I was surrounded by the cause of some horrific death and carnage. Once this thought was in my head it made the night very different. The Ball of Light was there to protect me though! Taken in the Barossa Valley, South Australia.
 
Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.

name: Long Distance Love
description:
The Remarkable Rocks are incredible in their immensity and form. This image not only puts the place into context, but adds the dimension of altitude to the formation. 

I think the Ball of Light was developing a bit of a crush on the lighthouse in the distance. The bush on the right of this image was decimated by bush fire in 2007. The lush new green is the regeneration from those fires. The forces of nature abound on Kangaroo Island.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Light Dance - Limited Edition
description:
For me this image congers up the most emotion. And also was the most fun for me to create. I have used a substantial amount of "extra" lighting here to accentuate the incredible rock formations. And once again the Ball of Light seems to have carved its own little spot from the rock. 

The Remarkable Rocks are an amazing place that will remain burned into me. I learned so much about many things at this location!

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Standing Tall - Limited Edition
description:
When standing gazing up at these astonishing formations at the Remarkable Rocks you cannot help but wonder how? How were they formed, how long did it take, and how did they get here? The Ball of Light seems to have found a nice little spot. Perhaps it was meant to be?

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Light Dance
description:
For me this image congers up the most emotion. And also was the most fun for me to create. I have used a substantial amount of "extra" lighting here to accentuate the incredible rock formations. And once again the Ball of Light seems to have carved its own little spot from the rock.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: The Cradle
description:
One of the stunning things about the Remarkable Rocks on Kangaroo Island is the mind bending formations carved from the rock. These rocks have been formed by wind, rain and time in astonishing forms. 

The Ball of Light seemed at home in "The Cradle". Perhaps even secure? I will never cease to look at the these images and feel the wonder of time.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: The Bay - Limited Edition
description:
The Bay is an image that I feel conveys the incredible weather I experienced this night. The wind, rain and cold were incredible. Yet the moon gave a beautiful illumination of the beautiful space between me and the point. I love this image and it will always remind me of the night at Remarkable Rocks on Kangaroo Island.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Water - Limited Edition
description:
One of the amazing things about the trees at Lake Mungo was how they were searching for water. The exposed roots were fascinating. Taken at Lake Mungo, New South Wales, Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Origins
description:
This Ball of Light image made me fantasize that this was the surface of another world. Perhaps where the Ball of Light originated from? It certainly felt other worldly while I was there. Taken at Lake Mungo, New South Wales, Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Purple Crush
description:
The Port Willunga Jetty is a beautiful place at night. And the Ball of Light was enjoying just hanging about too. Taken in Port Willunga, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Solitary Freedom - Limited Edition
description:
I couldn't believe how free and alive I felt shooting in a place so remote from noise, people and pretty much anything really. The Moon Light was my friend, the silence my comfort. Being alone makes you go within. I would encourage anyone who has not been away to a remote place, to go, enjoy and think. Taken at Lake Mungo, New South Wales, Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: That Sinking Feeling - Limited Edition
description:
I am lucky enough to live in Adelaide, South Australia. This is a city blessed with beautiful beaches that are regularly smothered with picturesque sunsets and warm nights. 

This image was taken at about 5.00am, the light in the sky is a Blue Moon (the second full Moon in a calendar month). The Ball of Light appeared under the Grange Jetty and was in awe of the moon power and light! Taken in Grange, South Australia. 

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Walking the Kids - Limited Edition
description:
The Ball of Light was taking the new kids for a walk. I was lucky enough to capture them heading towards the water. Taken at Port Willunga, South Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Walking the Kids
description:
The Ball of Light was taking the new kids for a walk. I was lucky enough to capture them heading towards the water. Taken at Port Willunga, South Australia.

name: Infinity
description:
This Ball of Light makes me think about Infinity. Not only does the final shape make me think of the Infinity symbol, but I thought about the infinite opportunities Light Painting offers us.

No two Balls Of Light are the same, but adding reflection adds a whole new level of massiveness to it. I was so happy with this night. Bright moon, little wind, and a clear head.  Taken at Tennyson Beach, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

description:
While on location at this wrecking yard, I had ages to look at the cars and so started to figure out why each car one was there. Many were due to simple mechanical failures as the bodies were untouched. But many of them were obviously in bad accidents!

I came to the realisation that I was surrounded by the cause of some horrific death and carnage. Once this thought was in my head it made the night very different. The Ball of Light was there to protect me though! Taken in the Barossa Valley, South Australia.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Hobo Balls
description:
I've heard about Hobo's who spend nights in old rail cars. These two Ball's of Light must be old drop outs, but they certainly lit up a dull old place. There are dozens of these abandoned rail cars right in the middle of the inner Adelaide suburbs. Taken in Wingfield, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Old School Tonight
description:
The moon was so insanely bright this evening, I just had to make the most of the beach. It felt like the moon rose perfectly above me, then stayed still for ages. 

No two Balls Of Light are the same, but adding reflection adds a whole new level of massiveness to it. Taken at Tennyson Beach, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Softly Softly
description:
Some nights the Ball of Light amazes me with its softness. About an hour from when this image was captured a massive storm came in. I was very lucky to catch the Ball of Light in such a good mood! Taken in Port Willunga, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Seems to be Blossoming
description:
Some nights all the stars align together to bring me the perfect Ball of Light composition. This night there was a full moon, no wind and the blossoms were out - everything remained perfectly still. A week later I drove past this location and the blossoms were completely gone! Taken in Angle Vale, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Distantly Related
description:
Adelaide beaches feature many beautiful old jetties. The Grange Jetty is a place I have spent many balmy afternoons and late nights. This is the Moon (a Blue Moon) setting at about 5.30am.

The Ball of Light was in fine form and was reflective, perhaps even respectful of the other huge golden Ball of Light on the horizon.  Taken in Grange, South Australia, easily one of my favourite Ball of Light images.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

name: Under the Boardwalk
description:
The Grange Jetty is an ever changing place. The movement of the water around the long weather worn legs provides no end of wonderful photography. This image has been published internationally on two occasions. Taken in Grange, South Australia.

Open Edition prints are available in one size only (300 x 400mm) and are designed to fit a standard Ikea RIBBA frame. Each print is digitally printed in an unlimited print run, then hand signed by Denis Smith and packaged in a cello bag for protection.

Cut size is 30 x 40 cm with actual image area being 21 x 30 cm
<b>*RIBBA frame is not included in the print purchase.<b>

No two Balls Of Light are the same, but adding reflection adds a whole new level of massiveness to it.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Longing to Travel - Limited Edition
description:
My wife often says the Ball of Light reflects how I am feeling. This Ball of Light seems to be gazing off into the distance, longing to travel, see wondrous and amazing places long and far. Hallet Cove, South Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Feeling the Night - Limited Edition
description:
Sometimes the Ball of Light comes in a subtle and subdued way. There are so many elements that have to combine to make a great Ball of Light image. This night, this moment and this Ball of Light were perfect to me. Taken at Port Willunga, South Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.

name: Diesel & Dust - Limited Edition
description:
A photograph of this building was used on an album cover many years ago for Midnight Oil's album 'Diesel to Dust'.  When I arrived at this location it was as if the Moon had decided it was going to help by bumping up the brightness level for me. Taken outside the town of Burra, South Australia.

Each unique Ball of Light image is available as a limited edition of 20 in each size. The limited edition prints are personally checked, numbered and signed by Denis Smith prior to delivery.
